flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
printed_text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1[credit] more to rez.
stripped_printed_text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1 credit more to rez.

flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?
printed_text: Run HQ or R&D. Access → 0[credit]: Trash the card you are accessing.
stripped_printed_text: Run HQ or R&D. Access -> 0 credits: Trash the card you are accessing.

printed_text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
stripped_printed_text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.

printed_text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Run a remote server. If successful, instead of breaching that server, trash all cards installed in the root of that server.
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Run a remote server. If successful, instead of breaching that server, trash all cards installed in the root of that server.

printed_text:
Place 9[credit] on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
stripped_printed_text: Place 9 credits on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented. Errata from CR 1.4

flavor: I feel almost naked without it.
printed_text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
stripped_printed_text: 1 recurring credit Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.

printed_text: +1[mu], 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +1 mu, 2 recurring credits Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.

printed_text:
Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 subroutine.
X is equal to the number of hosted virus counters.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on this program.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 subroutine. X is equal to the number of hosted virus counters. When your turn begins, you may pay 1 credit to place 1 virus counter on this program.

printed_text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
stripped_printed_text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.

flavor: It always strikes twice.
printed_text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength.

flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
printed_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access → Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.
stripped_printed_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access -> Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.

flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
printed_text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
stripped_printed_text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. click, 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.

flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine.

flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break any number of barrier subroutines.

flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corps need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
printed_text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.
stripped_printed_text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.

flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
printed_text:
When you install this resource, load 16[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from this resource.
stripped_printed_text: When you install this resource, load 16 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. click: Take 4 credits from this resource.

flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
printed_text: 2[recurring-credit] (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
stripped_printed_text: 2 recurring credits (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.

flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
printed_text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1 credit.

flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
printed_text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
stripped_printed_text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2 credits.

flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
printed_text: Gain 3[credit].
stripped_printed_text: Gain 3 credits.

flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
printed_text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez 1 installed piece of ice.
stripped_printed_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Derez 1 installed piece of ice.

flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
printed_text: Choose 1 unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp may rez that ice. If they do not, they trash it.
stripped_printed_text: Choose 1 unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp may rez that ice. If they do not, they trash it.

flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
printed_text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.
stripped_printed_text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.

flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
printed_text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
stripped_printed_text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

flavor: Twice the fun.
printed_text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +1 mu Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
printed_text: Whenever you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.
stripped_printed_text: Whenever you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.

printed_text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2 credits: +3 strength.

flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
printed_text: Interface → 0[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter ends, if you used this program to break a subroutine during that encounter, trash this program.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 0 credits: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter ends, if you used this program to break a subroutine during that encounter, trash this program.

printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install this program, choose 1 installed piece of ice. Whenever you encounter the chosen ice, you may pay 1[credit] for each subroutine it has. If you do, bypass that ice.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength. When you install this program, choose 1 installed piece of ice. Whenever you encounter the chosen ice, you may pay 1 credit for each subroutine it has. If you do, bypass that ice.

flavor: Show-off.
printed_text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +3 strength.

printed_text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.
stripped_printed_text: X recurring credits Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones. Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.

flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
printed_text: [click]: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, change the attacked server to HQ for the remainder of that run.
stripped_printed_text: click: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, change the attacked server to HQ for the remainder of that run.

printed_text:
When you install this resource, load 8[credit] on it. When it is empty, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of breaching that server, you may take any number of credits from this resource.
stripped_printed_text: When you install this resource, load 8 credits on it. When it is empty, trash it. Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of breaching that server, you may take any number of credits from this resource.

flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
printed_text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
stripped_printed_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits to pay for removing tags. trash: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.

flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
printed_text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
stripped_printed_text: trash: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed. trash: Gain 2 credits.

flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
printed_text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. When you do, add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack.
stripped_printed_text: click: Draw 2 cards. When you do, add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack.

flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
stripped_printed_text: +1 mu

flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
printed_text: Draw 3 cards.
stripped_printed_text: Draw 3 cards.

flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
printed_text: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
stripped_printed_text: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.

flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars, and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
printed_text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
stripped_printed_text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.

flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
printed_text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
stripped_printed_text: Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn. Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

printed_text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.
stripped_printed_text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.

flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
printed_text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.
stripped_printed_text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.

flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
printed_text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
stripped_printed_text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.

printed_text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
printed_text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
stripped_printed_text: +1 link When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.

flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
printed_text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
stripped_printed_text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.

flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
printed_text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
printed_text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
stripped_printed_text: click: Gain 2 credits.

printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
printed_text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3[credit].
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3 credits.

flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
printed_text: [click], [trash]: Gain [click][click].
stripped_printed_text: click, trash: Gain click click.

flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
printed_text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
stripped_printed_text: trash: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.

flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
printed_text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
stripped_printed_text: Gain 2 credits or expose 1 card.

flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.

stripped_printed_text: Gain 9 credits.

flavor: Archaic but reliable.

stripped_printed_text: +1 mu, +1 link

flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.

flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."

stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, gain 1 credit if you have at least 2 link.

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
printed_text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
stripped_printed_text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.

flavor: Who wants to start a war?

stripped_printed_text: When you score this agenda, the Runner trashes 1 of their installed cards for each hosted advancement counter past 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card this way, take 1 bad publicity.

Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.

stripped_printed_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.

flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
printed_text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run. [subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

[subroutine] Trash 1 installed program.
[subroutine] End the run.

flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?

stripped_printed_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine End the run.

flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
printed_text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
stripped_printed_text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."

stripped_printed_text: Gain click click.

flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
printed_text: Gain 3[credit] and draw 1 card.
stripped_printed_text: Gain 3 credits and draw 1 card.

flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

stripped_printed_text: Install up to 3 cards from HQ (one at a time and paying all install costs).

flavor: "I will serve you…for a time."

You can advance this asset.

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
printed_text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
stripped_printed_text: 1 credit: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ. Subroutine End the run.

flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
printed_text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine Do 3 net damage.

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
printed_text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
stripped_printed_text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. Subroutine Trash 1 installed AI program. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
printed_text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine Do 2 net damage. Subroutine End the run.

flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru

stripped_printed_text: Subroutine The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
printed_text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
printed_text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card you revealed this way.
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2 credits for each card you revealed this way.

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
printed_text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during their last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
stripped_printed_text: Play only if the Runner made a run during their last turn. Do 1 net damage.

flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
printed_text: Choose 1 installed card you can advance. Move up to 2 advancement counters from 1 other card to the chosen card.
stripped_printed_text: Choose 1 installed card you can advance. Move up to 2 advancement counters from 1 other card to the chosen card.

flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
printed_text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
stripped_printed_text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.

flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
printed_text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
stripped_printed_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits during trace attempts.

When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 hosted advancement counters past 3.
This agenda is worth 1 more agenda point for each hosted agenda counter.
stripped_printed_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 hosted advancement counters past 3. This agenda is worth 1 more agenda point for each hosted agenda counter.

flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."

If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
stripped_printed_text: If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.

Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.

stripped_printed_text: When the Runner encounters this ice, they must take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. subroutine Trace 3. If successful, place 1 power counter on this ice.

flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.

flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory

When the Runner encounters this ice, gain 1[credit].

flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."

When the Runner encounters this ice, they must pay 3[credit], if able. If they do not, end the run.

flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise

stripped_printed_text: While there are no installed fracter programs, this ice gets +7 strength. Subroutine End the run.

flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

stripped_printed_text: Draw 3 cards.

Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in their credit pool.

flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

X must be equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement counters on 1 installed card you can advance.

Play only if the Runner made a successful run during their last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace>. If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

flavor: Moving Upwards.

flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."

flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."

stripped_printed_text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. click, trash: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.

GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.

Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.

flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
